comment: He is a great professor, I learned much in his class. The tests are the hardest thing because of the amount of time you have. Make sure to do all the HW from the book & rework class probs because they will be on the test. If you stay on top the book HW & dont freak out on tests youll be good. DO THE BOOK PROBLEMS!!!!
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: This is my second time taking him. I feel his class has destroyed my soul. No offense Patrick!  Study more than the notes review extensively the homework problems. The homework is the key to passing his course and there is a lot of it.  He is tough. His exams are straight from the web assign homework, and examples.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Let me start off by saying, he does not post a SINGLE thing online. No syllabus. No slides. No posts. The only thing is the HW which is through webassign. His lectures are uninteresting and he never pauses through examples to give ample time to write down notes or understand the problem. He has a test roughly every 2 weeks with horrible averages.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Overall a good proffesor. For the most part he explains the topics pretty well.  Always there to help. His class is difficul, but that will be the same for any physics class. DO THE HOMEWORK. I guarantee if you do all the homework and go to recitation you will get an A.  Free response problems are very similar to the ones from recitation.

I had a different prof for physics, but ended up just going to Patrick's lectures instead. Made high A's on my tests thanks to him. He does move fast, so pay attention, ask questions, go to office hours. If you have a question, he'll answer it.

Do not take this professor. He has a test roughly every 2 weeks, and he purposely tries to trick you. After each test, he shows a bar graph of the grades that everyone received. 3/4 of the class fail. Apparently, he curves some at the end, but be prepared to fail every test.

The class is tough , and Professor Patrick makes it much much harder. He bring some questions that you have never seen it before and he expecting you know to how to get the right answer. He give par credits but not many... If you planing to take him, you should spend all your day just doing physics problems to prepare you a little for his exam.

Prof. Patrick was a great teacher. He's funny, explains things well, always there to help, and gives extra practice. 5 tests, one is dropped. 7 MC and 2 word problems. One MC is 8%. HW is simple if you take good notes and listen. Tests are similar to HW and extra practice problems. Be prepared to study hard. I studied my ass off and got an A.

Okay. I barely made it out of there with a B. Hardest class I've ever taken and it shouldn't have been. I got an A+ in highschool physics and he made this class hard for no reason. 5 test. Averaged 84 on tests. He drops the lowest. 7 multiple choice questions per test each one is worth a letter grade. If you slip up one MC ques? There goes your A.
Hardest class ever

Dr. Patrick is great as a person but for me, it was difficult to follow along and here I thought I loved physics. If this is your first time taking a Calc-based physics course, I advise you to take Intro to Physics or another professor. He does cover examples but you do jump right into it so I hope you're a quick learner.

Disregard everything you have praise-worthy you have heard about this professor because they are LIES!  Let me start by saying I have a 3.0 gpa at the point in time so by no means am I a slacker.  His test questions are so unrelated to anything in the book or homework that you almost think he wants the class to fail.  Avg. test scores were 60% run!
He is a great professor. I learned a lot in his class. Make sure to attend the lectures and recitations.

I love Dr. Patrick. He's really funny and interesting! Dynamite combo! You will need to work. I love hard classes. He's tough, but not impossible. DO THE HOMEWORK! If you do the homework and understand the concepts, you'll do great! I loved practicing problems for his class. Always willing to help as long as YOU put the work in.

Patrick was a great lab prof. I loved him so much from PHYS 2211L that I took him again the next semester. He wrote the lab book so he knows how to interpret it. He has a good grading scale and is great about giving partial credit. The lab discussions beforehand can be long, but still important as they will help you understand the subject better.

Dr. Patrick's class wasn't a cakewalk, but physics isn't an easy subject.  If you understand the concepts he goes over in class and do all of the recommended problems from the book, you shouldn't have any trouble.  He even drops the lowest test grade.  I highly recommend him.

Dr. Patrick's physics class isn't easy, but with hard work and smart studying, it is possible to get an A. He is pretty willing to give help, but I personally think he's too smart for his own good sometimes. Definitely work on the homework assigned and pay attention to examples in class. Tests can be tough, so be prepared. Overall good teacher.

Great professor! I learned a ton of material in Dr. Patrick's class and now have a firm understanding of mechanics. If you love physics and can pay attention to the lectures you'll do well and enjoy the class too.

Very good teacher. He went over the material at a great pace, not too fast. Write down his sample problems from lecture and do the homework and you should be fine. Tests were short, just 7 multiple choice questions and 2 multi-part word problems. Ended up with an A.

Very good professor. He taught the material clearly, and worked a sufficient number of problems to explain concepts without being boring. His tests were easy as long as you put in some preparation, and he was very responsive to student questions and concerns.
He does not work nearly enough problems in class. There were questions on his test that we did not do in class or in the home work.  Not the best teacher!
Terrible... he doesn't like to help at all. there is no reason for him having office hours!!!dont take him!!!

Do your hw practice problems and go to every class and write down his examples. Practice all the hw and examples a lot because his test questions will be basically something you've seen before. Sometimes he will go over things in class that seem crazy hard but he wont put really hard stuff on his tests.

Don't take under any circumstances! Test nothing like the homework. My GPA is a 3.7.I still failed the first two test after doing homework assignments and studing for 10 hours, not to mention studing for 4 hours on free days.

Well, I took honors Physics in high school and smashed it.  I understood the basics. Did not enjoy his class!  Tests were very lengthy and hard.  I went in motivated, left distrought. I dont recomend him.  He is not very helpful and runs a fast paced lecture. Lots of bookwork assigned.  class average was fail on tests i squeezed a B

Clear.. but tests were short, thus two missed multiple choice questions are the difference between an A and a B. As long as you go over the hw problems and pay attention in class, you should be ok. Most test questions come from the HW.
Pretty good teacher.  Good at explaining things but his test are a little long and you can barely get them in.  Other than that he is an easy B if you put forth just a little effort.

I'm not sure why he got so many negative reviews on here.  His class is easy as long as you study and do the homework.  His tests are really easy.  I find it surprising that a lot of people don't consider this an easy A.  He is ridiculously smart and a good teacher. I highly recommend him.
Tough class, but as long as you do the homework problems you should be fine. I strongly advise buying the student manual. It really helps. Overall good teacher.
Good teacher. A little boring in class, but pays attention to detail. Adequately prepares you for class IF you do the homework or understand the material very well on 1st shot.
Nice guy, but does not adequately prepare you for his tests.
RUN, RUN RUN WHATEVER YOU DO DO NOT TAKE THIS TEACHER WORST TEACHER AT SPSU

AVOID AT ALL COST, HIS TEST ARE HARD HE GIVES A WHOLE BUNCH OF HOMEWORK TO DO AND THEN ONLY ONE QUESTION THAT RESEMBLES THE HOMEWORK PROBLEM IS GIVEN                       HE IS THE WORST TEACHER AT SPSU

I took a hard physics course in high school, so this class was fairly easy for me. Lab grades are pretty much an automatic A if you come and do everything. I did well on the first 3 tests, and just didnt study for last 2 or final. Made an A.

Here are 3 reasons why you should NOT take this class.  1) The lectures are way too fast and unhelpful.  2)  There is no way to study for his tests because they're not even loosely based off the homework.  3)  He goes out of his way to trip you up on the tests.  4)  Although he curves at the end of the semester, it's not nearly enough.
WORST PHYSICS TEACHER AT SPSU

Do not take. His exams are nothing like the homework questions the class average is failing and has been for everyone of the test. The only thing that helps at all is he is fairly easy with grading the  labs. Not recomended at all
No Comments
Knows the material very well, teaches in an easy to understand way. Homework questions are from the book and are way tougher than the tests.
